text:
Hey everyone,

Has anyone used the select field in a contact form to display a list of office locations and changed the submission email address based on the select field value?
yeah well that one’s a freelance client, and the site was built before i ever got involved….
meanwhile, the ajax load pulls in stylesheets that collide with the parent page’s stylesheets. why did the infographic people not think of that, i don’t know.
but by all means, use bootstrap for f’ing EVERYTHING.

Hi
You guys have probably come across this previously, but we are having the root (non-www) domain to www subdomain issue with a few of our clients. What IP would we point the A record to for the non-www domain to go to the www of the domain? The clients DNS does not support redirect.
HS is setup on the www of the domain for each of these clients

I've seen this service used before in cases like yours.
<https://redirect.pizza/>
Hope it helps!

Thanks <@U7DFBQQUS>
The HTTPS version of the site seems to redirect back to Redirect.pizza.

We set up source - <http://domain.com|domain.com>
destination - <http://www.domain.com|www.domain.com>
<http://domain.com> redirects fine but
<https://domain.com> goes to redirect.pizza

Any ideas?

not sure where to put this, but I am curious about 404 erroring. Right now, with a 404, it shows the template we select in settings. Is there a way to capture where the user is coming from to track down any 404's? Possibly using a 404 page instead of a template and then in g-analytics, looking at the behavior flow?
wondering how ya'll address this problem
also working through this to get more insight: <https://www.searchviu.com/en/404-errors-google-analytics/>
Ok, so looks like a page is not the way to go, but still open to suggestions if folks have best practices
the search console will do this for you but it's not as instant as an actual monitoring service would be
it wouldn't be too hard to use some hubl variables inside of a google analytics script
